alert.note: Alert for Catron; Cibola; McKinley; Rio Arriba; Sandoval; Socorro (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 22 at 11:58AM MST until February 22 at 12:45PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Cibola County in west central New Mexico... Northeastern McKinley County in west central New Mexico... Central Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... Central Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... Northwestern Socorro County in central New Mexico... Northeastern Catron County in west central New Mexico... * Until 1245 PM MST. * At 1157 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near El Vado Lake State Park to 11 miles north of Omega, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 73 and 118. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 34 and 89. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 172 and 197, and between Mile Markers 201 and 210. Locations impacted include... Grants, Milan, Cuba, Laguna Pueblo, Tierra Amarilla, Acoma Pueblo, Cebolletita, Regina, Youngsville and El Vado. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Avoid or delay travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.

area.areaDesc: Catron; Cibola; McKinley; Rio Arriba; Sandoval; Socorro
